modules.description: This module implements a microexecution framework for running arbitrary code fragments in randomized contexts. It provides core operations for defining and executing code units with controlled inputs, using data structures like contexts and execution states. Concrete use cases include testing edge cases of functions, fuzzing, and exploring program behavior under uncertain conditions.

This module defines a policy type for concretizing symbolic values, supporting random selection, fixed values, and interval ranges. It includes a function to convert policies to S-expressions for serialization or debugging. Useful for test generation or symbolic execution where concrete values must be derived from symbolic representations.

This module provides functions to interpret and execute BIR programs within a defined context, managing program state and control flow. It operates on BIR program structures and execution contexts, enabling precise simulation of program behavior. Use cases include analyzing program paths, testing code under specific conditions, and verifying expected outcomes during execution.
